title: Understanding Robot Dynamics Basics
content: Today, we're going to learn about how robots move and the forces that affect their movement. Imagine a robot as a person trying to walk. Just like us, robots need to balance and move carefully to not fall over.
key_points: Robots move using forces and torques applied at their joints.
The Center of Mass (CoM) is crucial for a robot's balance.
External forces are needed for a robot to move in directions other than gravity.
The position where forces are applied affects the robot's angular momentum and stability.
examples: Think of a robot as a skateboarder. To turn, they shift their weight (changing their CoM) and use their feet to push (applying external forces).
A robot arm picking up an object must adjust its grip (force application point) to keep the object steady (control angular momentum).
